page.title: 18ARLEY WORKING MENS' CLUB
page.content: The club is a focal point for the community. It is known locally as the "Jampot". It was founded by the miners from Arley colliery (closed 1968) the majority of which moved from Durham when the mines opened- "Jammie" is a slang word for northener. The club committee had to apply twice before they were allowed to build the club, the original building being based on second hand timbers. The land that was used was a disused army camp - 2 old huts were removed to make way for the club. The club has a history of involvement in the community and its members were acknowledged locally as "grand chaps; bluff and hearty, kind and generous".
